title: Mandhana, Rawal tons make India clinch last semi-final spot
byline: Superb centuries from Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal powered India to a 53-run win over New Zealand and into the Women’s World Cup semi-finals on Thursday.

title: Messi signs new Inter Miami contract through 2028: club
byline: Lionel Messi has agreed a contract extension with Inter Miami which will see the Argentine superstar remain in Major League Soccer until the end of the 2028 season, the club confirmed on Thursday.

title: NBA stars and mafia among dozens arrested in illegal gambling crackdown
byline: An NBA player and coach are among dozens of people arrested as part of a sweeping FBI investigation into illegal sports betting and rigged, mafia-linked poker games.

title: Marathon record holder Chepngetich given three-year ban
byline: Women’s marathon world record-holder Ruth Chepngetich has been banned for three years after the Kenyan admitted to anti-doping rule violations.

title: Comet ‘Lemon’ visible in evening skies: Scientist
byline: Comet ‘C/2025 A6’, also known as Lemon, can currently be observed in the evening skies, space scientist Gihan Weerasekara announced.

title: Exports cross US$ 12.9bn in nine months
byline: Sri Lanka’s export engine continued to gather pace this year with steady growth delivered across both goods and services.

title: Court awaits Customs’ decision on release of detained BYD vehicles
byline: The Attorney General yesterday informed the Court of Appeal that the stance of Sri Lanka Customs (SLC) regarding the release of detained BYD vehicles belonging to John Keells CG Auto (Pvt) Ltd - over a dispute relating to motor capacity, would be conveyed to court today (24), following consultations with the SLC.

title: Proposed Indo-Lanka bridge may open door to smugglers: Mahanayake Thera
byline: Mahanayake of the Malwatta Chapter Ven. Thibbatuwawe Sri Siddhartha Sumangala Thera said Sri Lanka is already facing the threat of smuggling of contraband goods and narcotics by sea and that it would worsen if the proposed bridge linking Sri Lanka and India was built.

title: Scientists causing environmental harm through inventions: Environment Secretary
byline: Environment Ministry Secretary K.R. Uduwawala said that, in general, scientists are contributing to environmental damage through their new inventions.

title: Vehicle loans surge to Rs. 1.16 trillion in first half of 2025 - Central Bank
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) announced that by the end of the first six months of 2025, financial institutions in the country had granted a total of Rs. 1,161 billion (approximately) as vehicle-backed loans, reflecting strong demand following the easing of import restrictions earlier this year.

title: Body found near Adani Terminal at Colombo Port
byline: The Colombo Port Police have launched an investigation after a body was discovered in the sea near the jetty of the Adani Terminal at Colombo Port, following a tip-off.

title: At least 20 dead as Hyderabad-Bengaluru bus catches fire near Kurnool
byline: At least 20 passengers were charred to death, while 12 others escaped with minor injuries after a private bus was gutted in a fire near Chinnatekur village in Kallur mandal, Kurnool District, Andhra Pradesh, early Friday, according to a report by Hindustan Times.

title: NBA stars and mafia among dozens arrested in illegal gambling crackdown
byline: An NBA player and coach are among dozens of people arrested as part of a sweeping FBI investigation into illegal sports betting and rigged, mafia-linked poker games.

title: Cyclone threat looms as Bay of Bengal system intensifies
byline: The low-pressure area currently located over the southeast Bay of Bengal, to the northeast of Sri Lanka, is expected to intensify further and move west-northwestward, the Department of Meteorology said today.

title: BYD clarifies global vehicle recall does not affect Sri Lanka
byline: Chinese electric vehicle manufacturer BYD has clarified that its recently announced global vehicle recall does not apply to Sri Lanka, assuring local customers that no BYD models currently operating in the country are affected.

title: Six Sri Lankan seafarers repatriated from Eritrea
byline: Six Sri Lankan seafarers who had been detained in Eritrea have been successfully repatriated to Sri Lanka through the coordinated efforts of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, in collaboration with the Sri Lanka Mission in Egypt and Eritrean authorities.

title: ’’Was raped by cop 4 times’’: Maharashtra woman doctor’s suicide note on hand
byline: A woman doctor, who was reportedly raped four times in five months by a police sub-inspector (SI), died by suicide at a district hospital in Maharashtra’s Satara on Thursday night.

title: Court delivers verdict in coconut theft murder case: Death sentence for first accused
byline: Homagama High Court Judge Navarathna Marasinghe today sentenced a man to death after he was found guilty of killing another man using a metal rod used for plucking coconuts, following a dispute over the alleged theft of two coconuts.

title: Opposition MPs call for establishment of Independent Youth Commission
byline: A group of Members of Parliament, led by former Minister Ravi Karunanayake, has called for the appointment of a Select Committee of Parliament to propose the establishment of an Independent Youth Commission of Sri Lanka, aimed at empowering young people and restoring their confidence in the country’s democratic process.

title: Monsoon Lessons: What the rains teach Sri Lanka about resilience
byline: Sri Lanka’s monsoon rains have brought floods, landslides, and rising dengue risk across the island. While transport and crops face disruption, the downpours also refill reservoirs, revive farmlands, and cool the air. The season, though harsh, reminds Sri Lankans of endurance — and the balance between nature’s challenge and its gift.

title: Govt. dental surgeons to launch island-wide strike
byline: The Government Dental Surgeons’ Association (GDSA) has announced an island-wide token strike on November 6, 2025, in protest over what it describes as the “ongoing administrative collapse” within the Dental Services Division of the Health Ministry.

title: Police deny withdrawal of security for Kirivehera Chief Incumbent
byline: Sri Lanka Police today rejected media reports claiming that security assigned to Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thero, Chief Incumbent of Kataragama Kirivehera Rajamaha Viharaya and Chief Prelate of Ruhunu Magampattuwa, had been withdrawn.

title: 76 long-term Army vehicles refurbished and deployed
byline: Following the directives of Army Commander Lieutenant General Lasantha Rodrigo , 76 vehicles that had been out of service due to long-term use have been fully restored and added back to the Army fleet today (24 October).

title: Ex-Fisheries officer, minister’s staff arrested over job bribe
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) arrested two individuals today in connection with allegations of soliciting bribes for government positions

title: Plans to regulate eateries catering to long distance bus passengers: Deputy Minister
byline: The government has launched a programme to regulate wayside eateries that cater to passengers on long distance buses, Deputy Minister of Transport and High Ways Prasanna Gunasena said today.

title: MP Jagath Vithane says his life is in danger
byline: Opposition MP Jagath Vithane told Parliament today that he is facing a death threat and it has been confirmed by the Inspector General of Police (IGP) as well.

title: Sri Lankan woman found dead In hotel In Uttar Pradesh’s Shravasti
byline: A 71-year-old Sri Lankan woman was found dead inside a hotel in Uttar Pradesh’s Shravasti, officials said on Wednesday. The deceased woman has been identified as Kodgoda, the wife of Sunil Shanti De Silva, the officials said.

title: Teachers, principals warn of strike over extended school hours
byline: The Teachers and Principals Trade Union Alliance has strongly opposed the government’s decision to extend school hours by 30 minutes under the proposed education reforms set to take effect in 2026.

title: Thai government moves to bring back 2 gifted elephants from Sri Lanka
byline: The Thai government is set to hold talks with Sri Lanka on October 28 to bring back two elephants that were gifted by Thailand, following reports of poor living conditions and alleged mistreatment.

title: SL has informed OHCHR its objection on international mechanism on human rights issues: PM
byline: The government of Sri Lanka has officially informed the Office of the UN High Commission for Human Rights (OHCHR) that it is opposed to an international mechanism to address human rights violations as such mechanisms create divisions among communities in Sri Lanka, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: President Trump pardons Binance founder Changpeng Zhao
byline: Changpeng Zhao, founder of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange Binance, has been pardoned by US President Donald Trump.

title: COPF approves Budget 2026
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (COPF) has approved the Budget 2026 despite pending clarifications on some expenditure heads.

title: Inclement weather conditions claim four lives
byline: Inclement weather brought on by the depression located in the Southeast Arabian Sea has claimed four lives to date, Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said yesterday.

title: Time to change laws on election of Nilames in temples, devales
byline: The election of a Diyawadana Niame of the Sri Dalada Maligawa and Basnayake Nilames of other devales came into the limelight in Parliament today with the Opposition calling for the change of traditions enabling women Divisional Secretaries to vote at the polls held to elect such Nilames.
